name: cleistogamous
content:

Cleistogamous plants have small, closed flowers, that pollinate (= create new plants) themselves, often in addition to larger, open flowers on the same plant. Cleistogamous flowers are small and always closed: A cleistogamous species consists of individuals that produce both chasmogamous (open) and cleistogamous (permanently closed) flowers. The species is cleistogamous, as are many annual grasses in California. Compare
chasmogamous
More examplesFewer examplesCleistogamous (i.e. closed) flowers have very small petals and produce little pollen.In addition to producing open flowers, many species produce cleistogamous flowers that have to self-fertilize.Several of these species are often referred to incorrectly as being cleistogamous.
